Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. She&#39;s working on gettin those Yelp likes
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Happy hour menu!

jftU3OmvKQVoUfbBJR10eg.text: Kabuki has been one of my faves. Great customer service and atmosphere. Had the Seafood Udon and BBQ Beef Ribs, both were really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. BBQ Beef Ribs
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seafood Udon

irRqvjZJOI9LJf_Rxp5pAA.text: Moving from NYC - Tempe I thought my love for sushi would have to take a backseat. I ignorantly thought that there was no way sushi could be as good, or as fresh in the middle of the desert. Kabuki has proved me wrong time and time again! The fish is fresh, silky and buttery - as it should be. The poke bowl is my favorite! Pricing is amazing compared to NYC as well.  TL;DL I'm about it.

inr3zKNIkkH_vgAXy5WlFQ.text: Went there tonight (Aug. 13) the staff who greeted us and all the others were super nice and welcoming.  Jena J. was our fantastic server.  Very smart and well informed girl she deservers five stars on her own.  We had a variety of sushi and miso soup.  Food was all great and fresh.  Will be back.

ZvttCSaMzNssTqJ_JmOPxg.text: I've came here before and the food was fine but today my chicken was weird and pink and smelled like wet dog from far away I found out what the smell was and it was their teriyaki chicken I didn't want to be rude and say anything but I won't be coming back the wet dog smell scared me and I didn't even get to enjoy my meal

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Paid 14 dollars for a chicken plate that smells like wet dog was to scared to eat it

XkMJheb0tbBcdsg5MVUsiA.text: Dined here with a group of friends. Our server guy seemed new. He couldn't answer questions about the menu and forgot things so we had to remind him. But overall nice kid. Food was pretty tasty. Not really my go to sushi place but I want to go back to try their ramen and poke bowls.

-Mkc55pIClD537ufseBDZw.text: I went here last night to celebrate my mother's birthday with her and my fiancee. I've never been before and was quite impressed with the menu selection. I ended up getting the Unagi Bowl and asked that they hold the avocado. My mother ordered the Teriyaki Chicken and my fiancee got a Spicy Ramen bowl. When the food arrived we were less than impressed.   My bowl had the avocados in it that I had asked them to hold. It also took some spices to really make the dish taste better. My fiancee needed a combination of spices and hot sauce to make her ramen close to palatable. Her broth also looked watery and akin to chicken noodle soup. My mom enjoyed her dish, but it's disappointing that the most basic dish was the one they nailed. It's not a terribly expensive place, but for the price, I would have expected more.  There are tons of other places to go for good Japanese cuisine. I can't really recommend this place for anything out of the ordinary. For basic dishes, they are fine. But I probably won't return any time soon.  UPDATE 4/15: Zhen, the floor manager, reached out to me shortly after the review to invite us back to try Kabuki again. We went back today for lunch and the food was much better! I had the salmon teriyaki bowl lunch special and my fiancee got the Kabuki Deluxe lunch special. The presentation of the food was great and Zhen personally came by to ensure our orders were made to our liking.   This experience was far better than our original one and I would be happy to return at any time. Thank you Zhen for helping us out!

OQx9ph1X31rwmS_0DQ73Tw.text: So this night we were "one of those customers" that comes in a half-hour before closing time. Lol. We were hungry so why not? It was their "Reverse Happy Hour" which I think it a stupid name. To them it just means a happy hour at a later time. Anyway, we loaded up on the specials! Edamame is served on the house as well which was fresh and tasty. We ordered the Tokyo Quesadilla, Calamari Rings,a Spicy Tempura Roll and Las Vegas Roll. Everything was fantastic. The Tokyo Quesadilla took me by surprise because it was basically a mozzarella stick, but in a pot sticker casing! Delicious. Our serves were also very attentive to making sure we had everything we needed and keen at giving us suggestions. I'd totally come back here.

-Ll7iV64PXxTLba2ucouuw.text: Today our server was Taylor. Super attentive and never let my cup of water run dry. This place has the best spicy tuna. Today, the texture of the rice was a bit off. More on the hard side than the fluffy side. However, it made up for Taylor's top notch serving skills.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dynamite and Alaskan Roll

PNTBH7G8CIVrbgLSrCFXuQ.text: I have gone to Kabuki for HH a several years back with my Japanese friends. The food was good, but the ambience was way too noisy... I don't know what's that about the restaurants in America... It is extremely difficult to find quiet or at least the BGM is not obstructing the conversation restaurants. Not like in Japan where it's much easier to find one!   Anyway, since last year I started picking up sushi & appetizers to go for dinner. I like their packaging, but their portions are rather small for the price.

Fc90NxIYkJ8gWh9gqb8yuA.text: My husband and I come here about once per month! We really enjoy the outdoor seating in Tempe marketplace. They have great drink selections with the flavored margaritas being particularly delicious.  As a non-seafood fan, there is plenty on the menu that I can eat. I love the sesame chicken (it's got a great kick to it) and I love the california tempura roll. They give you a side of edamame free when you order sushi.  My husband is slightly more adventurous and likes the Dynamite roll.  We've also had the seaweed salad and enjoyed that. Definitely will continue to go back!

lCvfMIjQfYs41LqIatl9JA.text: Normally the service here is great. Tonight was not a good night. Never got our waters.  My partner got his main course before mine and the appetizer. The dumplings were cold. And He was almost done by the time my food arrived. The sashimi was cut too thick.  The overall experience was just bleh.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States

OqetVqjTwoqMx58c9dVuKQ.text: Consistently clean, efficient service.  Happy hour rocks.  Tonight we had the baked Salmon roll.. oh my - warm, basically a California roll with salmon baked on top. Like a whole meal right there!   Complimentary edamame hits the spot.  And the exquisite decor makes it a refreshing experience.  My waiter was even happy to put cucumbers in my water as there were no decaffeinated iced tea.  Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States

VVtqtc5kbLY4LGGKuhWtug.text: I can't give enough praise for this restaurant and the staff.  My birthday party had to make a restaurant switch after waiting 2 hours at Gen Korean next door (don't go there they are rude/ and have bad business practices).   After being moved to the back of the wait list for 2 hours I had enough.  My party of 23 people went to Kabuki with (20 minutes left to close).  The manager and her staff did not turn us away.  She kindly made an area for us, and sat us pretty promptly. While we waited the manager comped appetizers for us of edamame and dumplings to make up to us for having such a bad situation happen to me on my birthday. SO KIND AND CONSIDERATE.  The wait staff got our drink orders and our food out to us really fast. My husband and i and two others  got the dream platter to share. it was SOOOOOOOOOOO Good.  My other friends also enjoyed their meals.    We did not feel rushed out of the restaurant but did respect that the waiters/ kitchen staff, and manager stayed later to help us.   I HIGHLY recommend and would definitely go back.  A+++ for Kabuki on my birthday celebration.

nFt-o3sHnnSqe7xWkNfIzA.text: Mom. Dad. Toddler. New Years Day (evening). Seated immediately. Toddler ordered the sesame chicken w/ fruit, brown rice and a mini veggie roll...he's gonna be a big guy. Mom/Dad ordered the ramen combo (off of the lunch menu...yes, they offer it for din din too!) I got the spicy tuna roll and she had the California roll. The food was incredible!! All of it! We ate the banana tempura for dessert and it was phenomenal!!! We'll be back :)

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. I&#39;ll have the Tonkotsu Ramen
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. And for the lady, the Spicy Vegetarian Ramen Combo
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dude-Guy was super hyped on his meal and tried sushi for the 1st time...he LOVES it!!

tsp47g3fYxFETEVmwEZSlw.text: Kabuki is hands down one of the best sushi places in town. The perfect meeting point of great quality and taste and reasonable prices. I personally love their cilantro albacore roll and lava roll but whenever I'm craving some deliciously warm food I go for their spicy seafood pasta- absolutely to die for!!! Of course though, great food is best accompanied by amazing service and our waiter Matthew was more than accommodating and went above and beyond with his amiable personality and wonderful suggestions. Last but not least the local menu specials are phenomenal- Sakura saketini... 10/10!

FqBSu9xbhQ6pvYr-p-b12g.text: The food is good but lacked the finesse that usually comes with high quality Japanese dishes.  I came here only for a hard to find dish called Sukiyaki. I called and asked if it was cooked or brought out in the traditional hotpot so I can cook it it tableside.  The person that answered said.. Yes. It's cooked tableside.  When I arrived. .I was told it only comes pre cooked, not at tableside.  The dish I ate was yummy  But it Definitely wasn't Sukiyaki.  It was a good beef soup.  90% beef 10% onions and table mushrooms.    Regular Sukiyaki comes 50/50 with Japanese veggies and beef.    Very disappointed   So I Tried The cucumber wrapped king crab.  The slices of cucumber were so thick.....Instead of thin..that I almost choked on it.  What a let down  But the only thing that was exceptional. Was the coconut infused sake at 21 a bottle.  Very expensive but very tasty!  I also loved the  Shishito pepper appetizer.  Very yummy with Bonito fish flakes, garlic and teriyaki style sauce  American Japanese with a corporate taste and no passion for their food.  But I'm sure the wide variety of  sushi is probably the only thing I would ever order if I come back for.

yflbvZTVsBQOnkYJP7SnFw.text: First of all. Kabuki is a great restaurant. Known for fresh sushi (which I had). Their overall menu is so underrated. Fried rice? Such a simple dish. Not here. It's phenomenal. House made drinks are thought out and amazing. My server Jaime went above and beyond. With such a diverse menu he was able to answer every question our table had with patience. Ordering sushi is a process. He just just happily answered every question and help some people order sushi who've never had it. I'll def be back for the food. But I'll always ask for Jaime.

W2HMkWPpy_N49wZwKrT1aQ.text: So I am a sushi NUT. I LOVE the stuff. I had never been to Kabuki but a friend requested we meet here for a late lunch/early dinner on a late Friday afternoon.  The location is great with tons of parking in Tempe Marketplace. Upon walking in, it has a very modern feel and a very open floor plan. The staff was nice enough upon my entrance and I was walked to my friends table.  It took a minutes for the waitress to come by and take our drink order but she was very pleasant and provided us with a few recommendations as we didn't realize we were there during happy hour. The happy hour menu was definitely big enough and provided an amazing selection. Not to mention the prices were ridiculously inexpensive. We ordered a couple of rolls to get us started (the Philly roll and spicy tuna roll I believe). We split them and we're both impressed with the quality - especially for the price! We then ordered the Baja roll which was AMAZING!!   The only reason for four stars instead of five was due to the fact that once we're done with our food instead of offering to refill our drinks the waitress simply dropped off the check and never came back again. Other than that it was a great experience and I will definitely be coming back!

ZFt5Le2eYR_XW3aTlY1-FQ.text: This is by far my favorite sushi place in Tempe. The prices are cheaper than other places I've been and the portions are much better. Every single roll is incredible. I love that they have a diverse menu - the teriyaki and ramen are great. Happy hour and reverse happy hours deals are fantastic! I have been here so many times and will continue to go here. Amazing food, good atmosphere, friendly service almost every single time.

F1r5Ld0Ez1Lx6AYiax_aKg.text: Although the sushi rolls from Kabuki are tasty, I would have to say their poke bowls is probably the best thing from the menu! The sake sangria is also a must.   Best time to come is during their happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Poke Salmon and Sake Sangria

KCdan7VTNQg_tAPPn7nPGw.text: Ordered a sukiyaki beef, with brown rice. Meat was over fried where it should not be what sukiyaki be like, soup taste just soy sauce instead of sukiyaki. Yam noodle wasn't cooked fully. About the brown rice, it is not soak long enough and it should cook way longer than white rice to taste better. It taste like eating dried hard half raw rice. Waiter changed my rice into white rice at the end but the sukiyaki taste actually.... (can't describe my feelings)  The spicy tuna crunch roll taste not bad but too big for a mouth to occupied.   However the unagi bowl is fine~ and the waiter's service was fine actually!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Yam noodle wasn&#39;t cooked enough, beef over fried, which a sukiyaki should not have. Soup was not what sukiyaki soup should taste.
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. See how big is the roll? A thumb big huh?

ZIOZFqwWVuGAnEBUNcol0A.text: Tried a bunch of mom and pop sushi places around town and I regret I did.  Kabuki was incredibly good.  I got the moriawase, everything was so fresh and perfect I couldn't pick a favorite.  The albacore was so tasty I may replace my usual order of eel w/ albacore in the future.  Service was also A+.  All around, a great choice on a not very busy Saturday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Albacore sushi,  philadelphia roll

9UA9oiSn7p291fmWBysm9A.text: I ALWAYS come to Kabuki for their sushi, especially during HAPPY HOUR! They have great lunch and dinner specials on rolls. Their happy hour is Monday through Friday from 3pm-6pm. That's when I get my $4 California roll! They also have a special gluten-free menu for lunch and dinner.  I LOVE that they have gluten-free soy sauce to go with my sushi! Whenever I've come in, they haven't been that crowded (but I usually come around 3). Our waitress was so sweet but hard to catch. It took a while to order and even longer to get our bill. We got a California roll and a Dynamite roll, they tasted very FRESH and LIGHT!   My friend ordered the teriyaki chicken as an entree. It came with a choice of WHITE or BROWN rice and a couple vegetables on the side. The chicken was cooked well and the sauce was a little on the sweet side. If you're looking for a GREAT place to get SUSHI at, I highly RECOMMEND you stop in (especially during happy hour)!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gluten-Free Soy Sauce
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Teriyaki
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. California Roll

YcwFeSeI5jNRuk5NCLSUhg.text: Definitely a favorite sushi place. The ambiance is fancy and everyone is so polite. The prices are not so bad considering the quality is fresh and delicious! The Kabuki roll was great that it offered a "tasting" of ahi, salmon, masago, salmon eggs, as well as a couple other combo pieces. Perfect! The lobster roll remains to be a favorite; the rolls are large, the lobster tender and generous. So good. We will be back again to try everything else. FIVE MORE STARS!

4A-re2KkPCxNytcACVOZaA.text: I've been here a few times. I've tried the California Roll, Shrimp Tempura Roll, Dragon Roll, Chicken Teriyaki Bowl, and the Tonkotsu Ramen. I've inhaled my food each time I come here.  In my recommendation, the Specialty rolls are great! The service is also fairly fast as well. Check this place out!

Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States

DgDfQWukdDTTiVtALBZ-kw.text: Albacore with cilantro was my favorite. I get it every time... hard to beat! Especially with the sauce it's served with on the side :p ask for two!!  We also had another dish BUT I forgot what it was. It's off the menu, you gotta ask. But check the pic out and see what they say it is :)

8OuaQ52amxpo-oX2TSUtQQ.text: Japanese is my favorite food and this was devastating. The texture of the chicken was spongy, the yum yum sauce tasted like straight Sriracha sauce. Way too spicy. And we got our food BEFORE we got our drinks. Our waitress said it came with a side of broccoli and I kid you not, it came with 1 uncooked raw price of broccoli. I crave Japanese food but I won't ever be back to this restaurant.

-Xs_0E_37t9BDprclEJPtw.text: I've been going to this location since I moved to the downtown area. I love coming with my friends and getting drinks and food. The service is mostly good. One time had bad service but it was busy so I didn't mind. I like the sushi and so far everything that I've tried. The drinks are always spot on!   HAPPY HOUR!!!!! Go check out their happy hour you won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Albacore sushi
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Drinks and lunch!

CSPoO1sf7NlPqAUKh9mAgw.text: My husband and I tried Kabuki for our first date night out in a long time. The first thing I noticed when walking into the restaurant was how much dust was on the display shelves and bottles. Not ideal but not a big deal either. We asked to sit at the sushi bar. Our server was great and immediately took our drink and appetizer order. While waiting for apps we realized how dirty the sushi bar was. The countertop still had food remnants on it and the sushi case had a think layer of grime and dust on the outside. It definitely hadn't been cleaned in awhile. Unfortunately this made me lose my appetite and we canceled our order. We spoke with the manager who was sincere and listened to our concerns. If it weren't for the quality service I would rate one star due to the lack of attention to cleanliness.

D55daT1y1edZI8TGgdh8jQ.text: We always go see Danny, Randy and now Evalene for happy hour and love the great food and craft cocktails. Plus those three always are fun to be around. Relaxing environment in a perfect location

JvzIs3OxkvxC2lhad-MIFg.text: Kabuki is always a great culinary experience. If I go directly to the restaurant, I sit at bar and the service of the bartenders can't be beat. I highly recommend the mango jalapeno margarita as it's tasty and with a kick. The best appetizer by far is the tasty flavor of the broiled mussels topped with a baked cheese sauce and nuts. If you are feeling like a soup, you can not got wrong with the pumpkin squash soup. Some of the ultimate delicacy's include the uni (sea urchin) with a quail egg and the toro hamachi sashimi (fatty yellowtail). If you are feeling like not going to risky, easy, enjoy the Sunkist roll as it's an all time fav of many customers.   If you can't get out of the house, not worried as Door Dash offers delivery for free for Kabuki. If there is something the restaurant doesn't not have or needs to alter, they will call you within minutes of submitting your order and refund you any difference right then and there.   I hope you enjoy the information, my recommendations and this great experience.

Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States

3iNrWbkVcQZzl-avGR2gWA.text: Good services  The food is delicious I like here tempura ice cream with greentea icream is awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Unagi Bowl

IzkEN_3zeQZ5iKXfFf-t1g.text: I cannot rave enough about this place!!  My wife and I have been coming to this place for over 5 years (or however long it's been opened), and we have ALWAYS had an AMAZING experience. The staff from the waiters, to the bussers, the greeters to the managers - everyone has always been polite and awesome!! The food is always delicious and CONSISTENT - it doesn't matter it it's a weekday or weekend, lunch or dinner, holiday or not - the food always comes out exactly how you remember it from last time, and what you were hoping/expecting it to be. The drinks are refreshing, and their house saki is GREAT! David, the manager, has put together a great team of people!!! Shout out to: David, Bryan, Michelle, Celine, Leo, Aaron - and everyone else for always making sure I leave with a smile, raised spirits and a full belly!! 10 stars all the way!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fun times with Bryan at Kabuki!!

9eDGoGDqn0bgTBxydx5HiQ.text: Dinner was perfectly prepared and didn't have to wait for any course.   It's was all amazing and our server Jasmine was perfect.   Love this place when we are in town.

_eGpIUzbYY9hu4_WyfQspw.text: Kabuki used to be a go to happy hour spot for me when I lived in Tempe! Now it's kind of a pain to get there and Tempe marketplace is always so crowded so I don't go that often anymore. There is one menu item that keeps me coming back but that is it. I love the Firecracker appetizer! Spicy tuna with wonton chips that you make your own little nachos with and it's soo yummy! I get mine with no onion, extra cilantro.   The service has never been great, it seems like they have a big staff, a high turn over rate and there is always a new server that seems clueless.   I used to get the miso soup with crab (it was a bigger portion of miso with big chunks of crab meat) and the last time I was there the server seemed to have no idea what it was. So, I guess that is off the menu :(   I will keep coming back for that Firecracker but their sushi is pretty terrible and their ramen/noodle dishes are not authentic at all so I don't eat a full dinner here.

photos.caption: Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Firecracker appetizer
Photo of Kabuki Japanese Restaurant - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sizzling spicy chicken udon. Yuck! Would not recommend. Not sizzling or spicy... flavorless &amp; bland and noodles were very mushy. :(

yh00XmH9QSQ6oiOq-FKtnQ.text: We stumbled upon this place while shopping at Barnes and noble.  We love Japanese food.  They sat us immediately and the waitress came to take our drink order immediately. She was quick to return with our drinks and take our order. Everything else felt rushed.  Our food came out before the appetizers, the soup was luke warm and we were still eating when she asked if we were ready for the check.  She never asked if we wanted refills for drinks but al the food was great. She was eager to please.

HrO4Q88wv6MHmk6puZerYg.text: First time eating here, and I was delighted. Maybe we just got lucky since we got seated right away, and our service was fast.  However, I'm seeing a lot of less than 5-star review, but I think they should give them another chance because they sure have delicious food! I'm currently into this keto low carb weight loss eating, so I can't really eat high carb foods like pasta, bread or rice. I was surprised that they have a lot of keto friendly dishes here! They have salads, and soup and many low carb foods!  I had the sesame chicken minus the sauce, mushroom miso soup, and garlic edamame. Very delicious!
